member.name: M:AnalysisManagerBase.clsAnalysisResources.CopyFileToWorkDirWithRename(System.String,System.String,System.String,clsLogTools.LogLevels,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Copies specified file from storage server to local working directory, renames destination with dataset name
member.param: Name of file to copy
Path to folder where input file is located
Destination directory for file copy
Type of message to log if the file is not found
When true, then does not actually copy the specified file, and instead creates a file named FileName_StoragePathInfo.txt, and this file's first line will be the full path to the source file
member.returns: TRUE for success; FALSE for failure

member.name: M:AnalysisManagerBase.clsAnalysisResources.CreateStoragePathInfoFile(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a file named DestFilePath but with "_StoragePathInfo.txt" appended to the name The file's contents is the path given by SourceFilePath
member.param: The path to write to the StoragePathInfo file
The path where the file would have been copied to

member.name: M:AnalysisManagerBase.clsAnalysisResources.ResolveStoragePath(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Looks for the specified file in the given folder If present, returns the full path to the file If not present, looks for a file named FileName_StoragePathInfo.txt; if that file is found, opens the file and reads the path If the file isn't found (and the _StoragePathInfo.txt file isn't present), then returns an empty string
member.param: The folder to look in
The file name to find

member.name: M:AnalysisManagerBase.clsAnalysisResources.ResolveSerStoragePath(System.String)
member.summary: Looks for the STORAGE_PATH_INFO_FILE_SUFFIX file in the working folder If present, looks for a file named _StoragePathInfo.txt; if that file is found, opens the file and reads the path If the file named _StoragePathInfo.txt isn't found, then looks for a 0.ser folder in the specified folder If a 0.ser folder is found, then returns the path to the 0.ser folder
member.param: The folder to look in

member.name: M:AnalysisManagerBase.clsAnalysisResources.RetrieveSpectra(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves the spectra file(s) based on raw data type and puts them in the working directory
member.param: Type of data to copy
Destination directory for copy
member.returns: TRUE for success; FALSE for failure

member.name: M:AnalysisManagerBase.clsAnalysisResources.RetrieveSpectra(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Retrieves the spectra file(s) based on raw data type and puts them in the working directory
member.param: Type of data to copy
Destination directory for copy

When true, then does not actually copy the dataset file (or folder), and instead creates a file named Dataset.raw_StoragePathInfo.txt, and this file's first line will be the full path to the spectrum file (or spectrum folder)
member.returns: TRUE for success; FALSE for failure

member.name: M:AnalysisManagerBase.clsAnalysisResources.RetrieveDatasetFile(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Retrieves a dataset file for the analysis job in progress; uses the user-supplied extension to match the file
member.param: Destination directory for copy
File extension to match; must contain a period, for example ".raw"
member.returns: TRUE for success; FALSE for failure

member.param: Destination directory for copy
TRUE if .cdf file is needed along with .mgf file; FALSE otherwise
member.returns: TRUE for success; FALSE for failure

member.name: M:AnalysisManagerBase.clsAnalysisResources.RetrieveMZXmlFile(System.String,System.Boolean,System.String@)

member.returns: True if the file was found and retrieved, otherwise False

member.name: M:AnalysisManagerBase.clsAnalysisResources.FindValidFolder(System.String,System.String)

Optional: Name of a file that must exist in the folder
member.returns: Path to the most appropriate dataset folder

member.param: First file
Second file
Line at which to start the comparison; if 0 or 1, then compares all lines
Line at which to end the comparison; if 0, then compares all the way to the end
If true, then removes white space from the beginning and end of each line before compaing

member.param: First file
Second file

Line at which to end the comparison; if 0, then compares all the way to the end
If true, then removes white space from the beginning and end of each line before compaing

member.name: M:clsCodeTest.SplitFileRoundRobin(System.String,System.Int64,System.Boolean,System.String[]@)
member.summary: Reads strSrcFilePath line-by-line and splits into multiple files such that none of the output files has length greater than lngMaxSizeBytes. It will also check for a header line on the first line; if a header line is found, then all of the split files will be assigned the same header line
member.param: FilePath to parse
Maximum size of each file
When true, then looks for a header line by checking if the first column contains a number
Output array listing the full paths to the split files that were created
member.returns: True if success, False if failure

member.name: P:AnalysisManagerBase.clsRunDosProgram.CachedConsoleOutput
member.summary: Text written to the Console by the external program (including carriage returns)

member.name: P:AnalysisManagerBase.clsRunDosProgram.CachedConsoleError
member.summary: Any text written to the Error buffer by the external program

member.name: P:AnalysisManagerBase.clsRunDosProgram.CacheStandardOutput
member.summary: When true then will cache the text the external program writes to the console Can retrieve using the CachedConsoleOutput readonly property Will also fire event ConsoleOutputEvent as new text is written to the console
member.remarks: If this is true, then no window will be shown, even if CreateNoWindow=False

member.name: P:AnalysisManagerBase.clsRunDosProgram.ConsoleOutputFilePath
member.summary: File path to which the console output will be written if WriteConsoleOutputToFile is true If blank, then file path will be auto-defined in the WorkDir when program execution starts

member.name: P:AnalysisManagerBase.clsRunDosProgram.CreateNoWindow
member.summary: Determine if window should be displayed. Will be forced to True if CacheStandardOutput = True

member.name: P:AnalysisManagerBase.clsRunDosProgram.EchoOutputToConsole
member.summary: When true, then echoes, in real time, text written to the Console by the external program Ignored if CreateNoWindow = False

member.name: P:AnalysisManagerBase.clsRunDosProgram.ExitCode
member.summary: Exit code when process completes.

member.name: P:AnalysisManagerBase.clsRunDosProgram.MonitorInterval
member.summary: How often (milliseconds) internal monitoring thread checks status of external program Minimum allowed value is 50 milliseconds

member.name: P:AnalysisManagerBase.clsRunDosProgram.WorkDir
member.summary: Working directory for process execution.

member.name: P:AnalysisManagerBase.clsRunDosProgram.WriteConsoleOutputToFile
member.summary: When true then will write the standard output to a file in real-time Will also fire event ConsoleOutputEvent as new text is written to the console Define the path to the file using property ConsoleOutputFilePath; if not defined, the file will be created in the WorkDir (though, if WorkDir is blank, then will be created in the folder with the Program we're running)
member.remarks: If this is true, then no window will be shown, even if CreateNoWindow=False

member.summary: Constructor
member.param: Workdirectory for input/output files, if any

The arguments to pass to the program, for example /N=35
The name of the program to use for the Window title
If true, then returns False if the ProgRunner ExitCode is non-zero
member.returns: True if success, false if an error

Info on the most recent job started by this manager

member.name: M:AnalysisManagerBase.clsAnalysisResults.CopyDirectory(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Copies a source directory to the destination directory. Allows overwriting.
member.remarks:
The last parameter specifies whether the files already present in the destination directory will be overwritten - Note: requires Imports System.IO - Usage: CopyDirectory("C:\Misc", "D:\MiscBackup")
Original code obtained from vb2themax.com
member.param: The source directory path.
The destination directory path.
true if the destination file can be overwritten; otherwise, false.
The number of times to retry a failed copy of a file; if 0 or 1 then only tries once
When true, then will continue copying even if an error occurs

member.name: M:clsSplitCattedFiles.LineEndCharacterCount(System.IO.FileInfo)
member.summary: This function reads the input file one byte at a time, looking for the first occurence of Chr(10) or Chr(13) (aka vbCR or VBLF) When found, the next byte is examined If the next byte is also Chr(10) or Chr(13), then the line terminator is assumed to be 2 bytes; if not found, then it is assumed to be one byte
member.returns: 1 if a one-byte line terminator; 2 if a two-byte line terminator
